35232142: Severe flooding has affected areas in Scotland, including Newton Stewart, Hawick, and Peebles, causing damage to businesses and homes, and disrupting transport links.
40143035: Two tourist buses were deliberately set on fire at a hotel car park in Northern Ireland, disrupting the travel plans of German and Chinese tour groups.
35951548: Lewis Hamilton takes pole position at the Bahrain Grand Prix, beating teammate Nico Rosberg by 0.077secs, with Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen third and fourth.
36266422: John Edward Bates, 67, denies 22 charges, including indecency with a child, related to alleged sexual abuse of four males when he was a scout leader.
38826984: A young police officer under psychiatric treatment at Cerahpasa hospital in Istanbul threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting evacuation and negotiations with authorities.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors beat Dragons 31-24, with Simone Favaro scoring the decisive try in the final move of the game to earn his side a bonus point.
20836172: A 31-year-old woman was killed and another man injured when an Audi A3 struck them in Streatham High Road, London, on Saturday morning.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Antoine Demoitie dies after being hit by a motorbike during Gent-Wevelgem race, prompting calls for improved safety measures in professional cycling.
40758845: Ilkay Gundogan says he is nearing the end of his recovery from a knee injury and expects to return to Manchester City in a matter of weeks.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to hospital after a crash on the A127 in Essex, with the road closed for six hours for police inquiries.
34615665: Tropical storm Patricia becomes the highest category tropical storm to hit mainland Mexico since 1959, prompting questions about the category system used to measure such storms.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks found weaknesses in wireless mice from HP, Lenovo, Amazon, and Dell that allowed attackers to take control of connected computers.
37922330: Murray and Burrell, a Galashiels-based business established in 1928, has gone into administration, resulting in 38 job losses due to adverse trading conditions.
30844962: The European Commission has expressed doubts that Luxembourg's tax deal with Amazon constitutes illegal state aid, contradicting Amazon's claim of receiving no special tax treatment.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a 3-day event celebrating agricultural life, returns to Balmoral Park in County Antrim, featuring local produce, livestock, and family fun activities.
